revised_title: Obituary of William Bateson: A Pioneering Geneticist
tldr: This obituary honors the life and work of William Bateson, a pioneering geneticist who made significant contributions to the understanding of evolution and genetics. Bateson challenged the gradualism of Darwin's theory of evolution and introduced the concept of "discontinuous variation." He was a key figure in the acceptance of Gregor Mendel's work on genetics and played a crucial role in establishing the John Innes Institution as a leading center for genetic research. His work on genetics, including the study of linkage and segregation, has had a lasting impact on the field.
